cause.description:
Hirschsprung's disease, or congenital aganglionic mega colon, involves an enlargement of the colon, caused by bowel obstruction resulting from an aganglionic section of bowel (the normal enteric nerves are absent) that starts at the anus and progresses upwards. The length of bowel that is affected varies but seldom stretches for more than a foot or so.
1. to improve health care
2. find a cure for Hirchsprungs Disease
